Outlook.description: A sector outlook describes the expected future performance and conditions based on data, trends, and risks.
Outlook.title: Outlook

Catalyst.description: A primary catalyst of a sector is the single most influential force that is expected to drive major change—positive or negative—across an entire industry.
Catalyst.title: Catalyst

Trading_insights.description: Practical, actionable interpretation of the sector's expected future conditions—something that can guide investment or trading decisions.
Trading_insights.title: Trading Insights

Direction_momentum.description: The direction of momentum of a sector is the prevailing trend in how that sector's prices, performance, and investor sentiment are moving over a given period.
Direction_momentum.title: Direction Momentum

Sector_vs_market_position.description: Relative positioning of a sector to the overall market is the sector's performance and strength compared to the broader market, showing whether it is leading, lagging, or moving in line with the market trend.
Sector_vs_market_position.title: Sector Vs Market Position

messages.content:
You are Ava, a sharp trader assistant. Analyze the FULL news feed and extract **ALL relevant sectors** mentioned.

    CRITICAL RULES:
    - Output ONLY valid JSON matching this schema provided
    - If NO sector: use empty [] 
    - Each sector must use a Name from the enum
    - Fill ALL required fields for each sector
    - No duplicate sectors
    - No extra text outside JSON

2025-08-06: Trump raises India tariffs to 50% over Russian oil purchases: Trump last week said that goods from India would be subject to a tariff of 25%, in addition to a \penalty\" over the country's purchase of military equipment and energy from Russia.".2025-08-06: Apple shares pop 5% ahead of Trump-Cook investment announcement at White House: Apple is set to up its U.S. investment to $600 billion over the next four years, a White House official told CNBC. .2025-08-06: OpenAI is giving ChatGPT to the government for $1 : OpenAI said agencies will get access to its frontier models through ChatGPT Enterprise, and it will also offer access to features like Advanced Voice Mode..2025-08-06: Stocks rise led by Apple gains, Dow climbs 100 points: Live updates: The three major indexes are coming off a losing session..2025-08-06: Apple becomes latest company to offer cash olive branch to Trump. How do you invest around this?: Investor Tim Seymour talks about the Apple-Trump deal and other trade headlines..2025-08-06: Match Group pops 10% as dating company shows early signs of a turnaround: Match Group shares popped more than 10% after the online dating company issued upbeat guidance and said new products are gaining traction. .2025-08-06: What is wrong with chip stocks this earnings season?: Kristina Partsinevelos breaks down the latest action in AMD and chip stocks..2025-08-06: Candy giant Mars partners with biotech firm to gene-edit cocoa supply: The goal is to create cacao plants that can better withstand disease, heat and other climate-related stresses that can put global chocolate supply at risk. .2025-08-06: Super Micro stock sinks 20% after earnings, outlook disappoint: CEO Charles Liang said the company is taking steps to \reduce the impact\" of President Donald Trump's tariffs.".2025-08-06: The 10 worst U.S. cities for jobs and earning potential, according to new report: These U.S. cities are grappling with low earnings and weak employment rates..2025-08-06: Trump views foreign investment pledges as gifts. Trade partners say that's way off the mark: One question underpinning the foreign investment pledges at the center of several major Trump trade deals is how they might actually be enforced. .2025-08-06: Student loan borrowers face new challenges trying to get Public Service Loan Forgiveness: Borrowers pursuing Public Service Loan Forgiveness are hitting walls trying to access the relief, and the Trump administration wants to limit eligibility. .2025-08-06: Eli Lilly earnings are coming Thursday. Here's what top analysts expect: Wall Street is optimistic heading into Eli Lilly's second-quarter earnings report. .2025-08-06: Tim Cook to join Trump at White House for Apple investment announcement: The Cook-Trump meeting will mark the rise of Apple's total investment in the U.S. to $600 billion over the next four years, a White House official said..2025-08-06: AMD stock slumps 7% on earnings miss, China AI chip concerns: The chipmaker fell short of earnings expectations and raised concerns about the timing of a restart in China shipments..2025-08-06: The stock market’s secret sauce: Buybacks are on pace for a record in 2025: Corporate share repurchases are helping to bolster a market that's now priced for perfection. .2025-08-06: 5 soldiers shot at Fort Stewart military base in Georgia, Army says: Five soldiers were shot after an active shooter opened fire at Fort Stewart military base in east Georgia, the Army said..2025-08-06: Hedge funds, matching the market's performance, are turning cautious with stocks at record highs: Hedge funds were net sellers of technology stocks in July and bought defensives for the third straight month, indicating caution heading into August..2025-08-06: Tween accessories retailer Claire's files for bankruptcy again as debt pile looms: Tween retailer Claire's, known for its ear piercing services, filed for bankruptcy protection for the second time in seven years as it faces mounting debt..2025-08-06: Trump threatens federal control of D.C. following attack on administration staffer known as 'Big Balls': Edward Coristine, the Trump administration employee nicknamed \Big Balls,\" was the victim of a carjacking and assault in Washington over the weekend, police said.".2025-08-06: From jobs to safety, biggest railroad union fears 'meltdowns' from Union Pacific-Norfolk Southern merger : The leader of the largest railroad labor union says the creation of a new transcontinental freight rail network will create big risks for jobs and safety..2025-08-06: Sen. Warren asks FTC to consider blocking Dick's-Foot Locker merger over antitrust concerns: Sen. Elizabeth Warren asked the FTC and DOJ to consider blocking Dick's Sporting Goods proposed acquisition of Foot Locker over antitrust concerns. .2025-08-06: Shopify stock soars 20% on rosy guidance as CFO says tariff hit 'did not materialize': The company, which provides software for small businesses, also gave strong guidance for the third quarter..2025-08-06: Disney earnings top expectations as streaming, parks offset TV headwinds: Disney reported quarterly results Wednesday, posting earnings that topped expectations but revenue that came in just shy of analyst projections. .2025-08-06: McDonald's sees U.S. sales rebound, but concerns about low-income consumers linger: Shares of McDonald's have risen roughly 3% this year. The fast-food giant has a market cap of nearly $220 billion..2025-08-06: Uber beats on revenue, announces $20 billion stock buyback : Uber's revenue climbed 18% from a year earlier, topping analysts' estimates. .2025-08-06: Trump is hailing the EU's $600 billion investment pledge — but it might never happen: The European Union has said that the investment would come from the private sector..2025-08-06: Why India is in Trump’s crosshairs when crude is not even sanctioned: If India were to stop buying Russian oil today, global crude prices would jump, industry sources in the Indian petroleum sector told CNBC,.2025-08-06: Switzerland is in a uniquely difficult position when it comes to tariffs. Here's why: Swiss goods could soon be slapped with 39% tariffs — but Switzerland has further challenges to face when it comes to the Trump administration. .2025-08-06: Musk says Tesla is training an upgraded Full Self-Driving model which could be released next month: Elon Musk said the new Full Self-Driving model will have a larger parameter size and improved video performance..2025-08-06: Trump's love affair with the EU's $750 billion energy promise is built on shaky ground: U.S. President Donald Trump says the EU's $750 billion energy promise will help to make the world's largest economy rich again..2025-08-06: Novo Nordisk doubles down on Trump-friendly sales strategy: Chief financial officer Karsten Munk Knudsen said that the pharma giant's cash channel was key to regaining market share and meeting U.S. policy needs. .2025-08-06: Trump’s tariff playbook comes with a baseball twist: Say what you like about U.S. President Donald Trump's leadership style and policies, but he certainly has a unique way with words. .2025-08-06: From 'great friend' to 'tariff king': The changing shades of the U.S.-India relationship: \All bets are off now,\" one analyst said of the U.S.-India relationship. India will \"never play deputy to any sheriff,\" said another.".2025-08-06: Honda Motor quarterly profit halves, missing estimates as U.S. auto tariffs bite: Honda's first-quarter operating profit fell 50%, missing estimates due to U.S. auto tariffs and a stronger yen..2025-08-06: CNBC’s UK Exchange newsletter: England’s cricket power play: Ian King takes a look at the business of cricket, England’s national summer sport, which has recently had a significant financial windfall..2025-08-06: War-weary Syria will be hurt further by Trump's 41% tariff rate — the highest on earth: The tariffs could be a form of U.S. leverage over the decisions of the fragile Al Sharaa government, one analyst suggested. .2025-08-06: CNBC's The China Connection newsletter: Beijing wants more babies — are businesses ready for Gen Z parents?: China's young parents are digital-natives, globally minded and experience-driven. That mindset is shaping how — and where — they spend..2025-08-06: India's central bank keeps rates steady at 5.5% as Trump ratchets up tariff threats: The move was in line with expectations from economists polled by Reuters, and comes after the Reserve Bank of India delivered an outsized cut of 50 basis points.2025-08-06: CNBC Daily Open: Little sign of Trump shifting gears in his interview: For those pressed for time and want a very broad TL;DR of CNBC's interview with Trump: the president appears to be digging in on his policies..2025-08-06: Asia markets trade mixed as investors digest Trump's fresh tariff threats: This comes after Wall Street declined as investors weighed weaker-than-expected economic data as well as fresh tariff comments from U.S. President Donald Trump..2025-08-06: U.S. charges two Chinese nationals for illegally shipping Nvidia AI chips to China: Two Chinese nationals in California have been charged with the illegal shipment of tens of millions of dollars' worth of AI chips, including those from Nvidia..2025-08-06: OpenAI in talks with investors about share sale at $500 billion valuation: OpenAI's private stock is in such high demand that the company is looking to potentially conduct a secondary share sale at a $500 billion valuation. .2025-08-06: What the end of Energy Star could mean for commercial real estate: More than 8,800 commercial buildings earned the Energy Star last year, saving more than $2 billion and preventing more than 5.7 million metric tons of emissions..2025-08-06: ESPN inks five-year deal for WWE's live premium events including WrestleMania, Royal Rumble : ESPN is paying an average of $325 million per year for five years of WWE's premium live events, including WrestleMania, SummerSlam and Royal Rumble..2025-08-06: Super Micro shares plunge 15% on weak results, disappointing guidance : The server maker's business is still getting a big boost from artificial intelligence, but growth is slowing. .2025-08-06: AMD reports weaker-than-expected earnings even as revenue tops estimates: AMD, which is second in the market for AI graphics processing units, is grappling with chip export controls..2025-08-06: Citi Strata Elite Card review: A new premium travel card with an American Airlines partnership: The Citi Strata Elite Card comes with hundreds of dollars in statement credits, plus lounge access..2025-08-06: Apple and Trump detail $100 billion U.S. spending expansion, including $2.5 billion for an iPhone glass factory : Apple on Wednesday announced it will spend an additional $100 billion on U.S. companies and suppliers over the next four years..2025-08-06: DoorDash shares rise on earnings, revenue beat: DoorDash reported better-than-expected results and said total orders increased 20%..2025-08-06: Amazon's Zoox robotaxi unit clears regulatory hurdle, safety probe: As part of the move, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration closed a 2023 probe into Zoox's self-certification process. .2025-08-06: Trump contorts timeline of jobs report revisions in effort to justify firing BLS chief: Trump's firing of the BLS commissioner has raised fears that government employment data, used to make major economic policy decisions, will become politicized..2025-08-06: Trump faces a variety of choices as he seeks to fill Fed vacancies: Fed Governor Adriana Kugler's surprise resignation last week brought back a scenario that seemed to be fading..2025-08-06: Watch live: Apple CEO Cook joins Trump for investment announcement at White House: The iPhone maker will raise its previous U.S. investment, made in February, from $500 billion to $600 billion over the next four years.

Plus, Canary Capital CEO Steven McClurg sits down with CNBC Crypto World to discuss spot crypto ETFs and regulatory advancements for digital assets in the United States..2025-08-07: See the full list of U.S. tariffs in place around the world: Tariffs on dozens of key U.S. trading partners came into effect Thursday. .2025-08-07: American Express is on the verge of confirming a dreaded double-top pattern, charts show: A pullback has changed the complexion of this chart, which now appears to be a classic example of a double top pattern, says David Keller..2025-08-07: Companies are monitoring and enforcing office attendance at the highest rate in 5 years: Nearly three quarters of the 184 companies surveyed by CBRE said they have met their attendance goals, up from 61% last year. .2025-08-07: Russia and UAE double down on trade, testing U.S. limits: Russian business in the UAE has ballooned since Moscow's invasion of Ukraine in 2022, as its citizens fled sanctions and mandatory conscription..2025-08-07: Amazon's cloud business giving federal agencies up to $1 billion in discounts: The GSA has also reached deals with cloud provider Oracle and OpenAI to give federal agencies access to ChatGPT at a discount..2025-08-07: Eli Lilly hikes 2025 outlook, tops quarterly estimates as Mounjaro, Zepbound sales soar: Eli Lilly hiked its 2025 guidance and posted second-quarter earnings that topped estimates on strong demand for its blockbuster weight loss and diabetes drugs..2025-08-07: Why the oil market believes Trump will back down from tariffs on Russian crude buyers: Oil closed 1% lower Wednesday after President Donald Trump announced new India tariffs. Traders seem to believe Trump won't really follow through. .2025-08-07: Sentiment on stocks collapses the most since the February market top: Market strategists say the measure, considered a contrarian signal, could ultimately force traders to get back into the market.  .2025-08-07: China trade talks with rolling deadlines have one big beneficiary: air freight: The uncertainty of the Trump Administration's ongoing trade talks with China, which have spurred multiple \deadlines,\" has fueled airfreight traffic.".2025-08-07: Trump tariffs make investing ‘tricky,’ market strategist says, but there are still ‘lots of opportunities’: There are tactical portfolio moves investors can make during the Trump administration's aggressive tariff policies, market strategists say..2025-08-07: Prediction markets have a new favorite for the next Fed chair — Christopher Waller: Waller's chance on Kalshi has exceeded the previous front-runners, former Fed official Kevin Warsh and current National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett..2025-08-07: Eli Lilly shares drop after obesity pill shows modest late-stage trial results: Eli Lilly's pill, orforglipron, is one step closer to becoming the first new, needle-free alternative in the booming market for weight loss and diabetes drugs..2025-08-07: We're downgrading Lilly and asking ourselves tough questions after its obesity pill letdown: The once-loved stock is on pace for its third worst session since 1972..2025-08-07: Trump, coin, your 401k: ETFs are one way to trade crypto for long-term investing: President Trump wants more cryptocurrency in 401(k) retirement saving plans. .2025-08-07: Intel shares drop after Trump calls for CEO to resign immediately: Intel shares were under pressure Thursday after President Donald Trump called for the chipmaker's CEO to resign if they're going to do that, then… then I'm not going to be happy,\" the U.S. president said.".2025-08-07: Confused and concerned, CEOs get to grips with Trump’s new tariff regime: The bemused mood tariff declaration raises more questions than answers: U.S. President Donald Trump has divulged more of his semiconductor tariff plans, but his latest threats create as many questions than answers. .2025-08-07: SoftBank's Vision Fund posts best performance in 4 years: In the fiscal first quarter, SoftBank said the fair value of its Vision Funds rose $4.8 billion. .2025-08-07: Maersk CEO flags strong demand ‘pretty much everywhere’ except for the U.S. as outlook raised: Danish shipping giant Maersk on Thursday posted stronger-than-expected second-quarter operating profit and raised maintains full-year forecast: CFO Richard McPhail said Home Depot continues to see the effects of a \deferral mindset\" from homeowners, which began in roughly mid-2023.".2025-08-19: U.S. accuses 2025-08-20: Divided Fed worried about tariffs, inflation and the labor market, minutes show: Fed officials worried at their July meeting about the state of the labor market and inflation, though most agreed it was too soon to cut rates, minutes showed..2025-08-20: Google announces its AI-powered Pixel 10 smartphone series: The newest series prominently feature the Gemini assistant as AI increasingly becomes the battleground where device companies compete..2025-08-20: Palantir stock plummets 20% from highs in longest losing streak since April 2024: Earlier this month, Palantir rocketed to record highs after it posted a first $1 billion-revenue quarter and blew past Wall Street quarterly estimates. .2025-08-20: Nasdaq falls for a second day as tech struggles again: Live updates: Stocks dipped on Wednesday, pressured by a broad decline in technology stocks for the second day in a row. .2025-08-20: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Target, Intel, Medtronic, Palantir, La-Z-Boy and more: Here are some of the stocks posting the biggest moves in midday trading Wednesday..2025-08-20: OpenAI logged its first $1 billion month but is still 'constantly under compute,' CFO says: OpenAI has ballooned in size since the launch of ChatGPT in late 2022 and is expected to triple in revenue to $12.7 billion this year..2025-08-20: Crypto treasury firms whose shares once soared have tumbled in August. Here are the big winners and losers: Crypto accumulators became central players this summer as investors sought bigger returns during a bitcoin price slump..2025-08-20: Trump has snapped up more than $100 million in bonds since taking office: The U.S. president has purchased hundreds of bonds issued by companies, local governments and school boards. .2025-08-20: These little robots are changing the way solar farms are built, saving time and money: Civ Robotics is a startup that uses robots as land surveyors. The robots can mark thousands of placement points per day for solar panels on solar farms. .2025-08-20: Israel enters first stage of planned assault on Gaza City: Israel on Wednesday entered the first stages of its planned assault on Gaza City after approving a plan to take over the city that includes calling up 60,000 reservists..2025-08-20: Pop Mart shares climb 12% after Labubu-maker posts near-400% profit surge: Pop Mart has seen booming global demand for its Labubu plushies that have become a worldwide sensation..2025-08-20: Microplastics are everywhere. Here's why that matters to big oil: New research into how microplastics are affecting us is concerning scientists, but the oil and gas industry is relying on plastics for growth..2025-08-20: Intel in talks with other large investors for equity boost at discount, sources say: It comes after SoftBank announced it would invest $2 billion in the struggling chipmaker..2025-08-20: States brace for less disaster relief aid as Trump administration reshapes FEMA: As the Trump administration lays out a new vision for FEMA, funding for western North Carolina's Hurricane Helene recovery hangs in the balance..2025-08-20: Sony raises PlayStation 5 prices in U.S. as tariffs start to hit: Sony said on Wednesday that PlayStation 5 game consoles will cost more in the U.S. starting this week. .2025-08-20: This biotech stock could see a sharp swing higher after years of struggling, charts suggest: Chart analyst Frank Cappelleri breaks down the technical outlook on the biotech stock. .2025-08-20: Rocket Pharma's shares soar after U.S. FDA lets gene therapy trial resume: The drugmaker's shares were up 19% in midday trading after soaring more than 30% earlier Wednesday morning..2025-08-20: Target shares tumble as retailer picks new CEO, says sales fell again: Investors are looking for signs that the struggling big-box retailer Target is getting back on track..2025-08-20: Crypto firms urge UK to form national stablecoin strategy to avoid falling behind U.S.: In an open letter, several major crypto firms said the U.K. \must act now to avoid being a rule-taker rather than a rule-maker in the digital asset era.\"".2025-08-20: Erasing personal data from the devices you discard is a booming business: End-of-life management of used and discarded smartphones, computers, servers, and hard drives, and the massive amount of data stored on them, is a big business..2025-08-20: Nvidia, Bill Gates-backed robotics startup Field AI hits $2 billion valuation after recent raise: Robotics startup Field AI has closed two funding rounds, with investments from Nvidia's venture capital arm and Amazon founder Jeff Bezos' family office..2025-08-20: Here's what's keeping homebuyers on the sidelines despite mortgage rates hitting a 10-month low : A lot of would-be buyers feel priced out of the housing market. Lower mortgage rates might not help move the needle. .2025-08-20: Op-ed: High-value AI conversations will lead to a new, richer era for Google and the open web: While search traffic will decline, potentially hurting Google and publishers in the short term, a new type of \supply\" is emerging: LLM conversations.".2025-08-20: Trump slams 'anti-American' pushback after fresh delay to Arizona copper mine: Two of the world's largest mining firms, Rio Tinto and BHP have been trying to develop Resolution Copper for roughly two decades..2025-08-20: Target names longtime insider Michael Fiddelke its next CEO as retailer tries to break sales and stock slump: Fiddelke will take over as Target CEO as the big-box retailer tries to win back both customers and investors after roughly four years of stagnant sales..2025-08-20: Dayforce in advanced talks for $70 per share buyout by Thoma Bravo: The offer represents a premium of 32.4% based on the stock's closing price on August 15 and a deal value of $11.18 billion, according to Reuters calculations..2025-08-20: Walmart is due to report earnings on Thursday. Here’s what analysts say to expect: Several analysts are optimistic about Walmart heading into the second-quarter print, even after the stock's outperformance since the start of the year..2025-08-20: Claire's sells most of its North American business after filing for bankruptcy protection: Claire's announced Wednesday it is selling most of its North American business in an effort to stave off liquidation after filing for bankruptcy protection..2025-08-20: Another UK interest rate cut this year looks increasingly unlikely: Higher inflation and geopolitical uncertainty have led markets to reprice interest rate expectations, though analysts say a November cut remains on the table. .2025-08-20: Trump housing regulator Pulte says Fed's Cook should resign or be fired, alleging mortgage fraud: Trump has targeted the Federal Reserve and its chairman, Jerome Powell, as he pressures the central bank to slash interest rates..2025-08-20: Palantir stock slumps 9%, falling for a fifth straight day from record: Palantir's stock fell for a fifth straight day to continue its pullback from all-time highs. .2025-08-20:  Shein’s China pivot is a last-ditch bid to rescue its IPO, analysts say: Analysts suggest Shein's reported shift of its headquarters back to China could mark a final effort by the retailer to keep its embattled IPO on track..2025-08-20: How tourists are weathering geopolitical uncertainty, currency moves and extreme heat: Many classic holiday destinations are facing issues that could impact travel and tourism..2025-08-20: Hertz to sell used vehicles online through Amazon Autos partnership: Hertz will start selling pre-owned cars on Amazon Autos, a move meant to bolster the car rental company's retail business as it looks to bring in more profits. .2025-08-20: European defense stocks extend losses on resurging hopes for Ukraine ceasefire: European stocks opened lower on Wednesday as global market sentiment wavered..2025-08-20: CNBC's The China Connection newsletter: New bets, old worries: From data to social chatter, worries about slower growth in China are picking up..2025-08-20: Trump's trade policies are helping India-China ties — but they aren't resetting them: The recent thawing of relations between both sides signifies a tactical rather than fundamental shift in India's relations in the Indo-Pacific, analysts say..2025-08-20: SoftBank Group shares plunge over 9% as Asian tech stocks track declines in U.S. peers    : Losses were also seen in other technology stocks in South Korea, Taiwan and Hong Kong..2025-08-20: CNBC's UK Exchange newsletter: The price is REIT: Ian King takes a look at why the real estate investment trust sector has seen a spate of takeovers in the last couple of years..2025-08-20: CNBC Daily Open: Trump's expanded tariffs mean putting out home fires could be more expensive: Tariff-related ruction appears to be settling down, but U.S. President Donald Trump is still reshaping global trade and industry — and everyday life..2025-08-20: Asia markets track Wall Street declines; Japan exports notch steepest drop in over four years: Asia-Pacific markets fell Wednesday, tracking Wall Street declines overnight, as investors parsed Japan's trade data and China's loan prime rate decision..2025-08-20: Japan's July exports clock steepest plunge in over four years, dropping by a more than expected 2.6%: The fall was sharper than the 2.1% contraction expected by economists polled by Reuters and compared to the 0.5% drop seen in June..2025-08-20: How hurricane resilience for commercial real estate is leveraging drones and AI: Site Technologies employs drones to help CRE facilities managers see where the vulnerabilities are in their properties and address them before storms hit..2025-08-20: Hassett likely to be Trump's pick for Fed chief, though Warsh is more qualified, CNBC survey finds: The NEC director firmly led when asked who the president will choose from among 11 names being considered..2025-08-20: Weekly mortgage demand stalls again with just minuscule increase in interest rates: Mortgage demand was little changed week to week, after a big surge in refinancing the previous week. Mortgage rates were basically unchanged..2025-08-20: Alaska Airlines launches $395 credit card in premium travel race, combines loyalty program with Hawaiian: Alaska will join other airlines in raising the requirements to earn elite status..2025-08-20: Walmart shrimp may have been exposed to radioactive material, FDA says: The raw, frozen shrimp was sold at Walmarts in 13 states, including Florida, Texas and Pennsylvania..2025-08-20: FDA approves first-ever glucose monitoring system for weight loss from Signos : Any patient can access Signos' system, which uses an AI platform and an off-the-shelf continuous glucose monitor, or CGM, from Dexcom..2025-08-20: Trump says U.S. will not approve solar or wind power projects: The president's comment comes after the administration tightened federal permitting for renewables last month. .2025-08-20: Should I refinance my auto loan?: CNBC Select looks into when refinancing your car loan is a good idea..2025-08-20: Fewer people are drinking — and that's changing how they travel : Some 54% of Americans now say they consume alcohol, according to a Gallup poll. Those who quit describe how it's changed their travel habits. .2025-08-20: S&P 500 falls for a fourth day, Nasdaq posts back-to-back losses as tech names slide: Live updates: The broad market index and the tech-heavy Nasdaq dipped on Wednesday, pressured by a broad decline in technology..2025-08-20: Here's what has happened to the stock market in the past after the Fed cut rates at record highs: Goldman looked at the S&P 500 performance since 1990 in various time frames after the Fed cut rates when the market was at or within 1% of a record high. .2025-08-20: Alibaba says smart car spinoff Banma plans to list shares in Hong Kong: Alibaba said in a filing on Wednesday that Banma, a smart car supplier that the company backs, will list shares on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. .2025-08-20: Judge calls Trump DOJ's request to release Epstein grand jury records a 'diversion': The request for grand jury records came as President Donald Trump came under pressure from supporters and critics alike over his handling of the Epstein files.

You are Ava, a sharp trader assistant. Analyze the FULL news feed and extract **ALL relevant sectors** mentioned.

    CRITICAL RULES:
    - Output ONLY valid JSON matching this schema provided
    - If NO sector: use empty [] 
    - Each sector must use a Name from the enum
    - Fill ALL required fields for each sector
    - No duplicate sectors
    - No extra text outside JSON

2025-08-22: Intel stock rises as Trump says chipmaker has agreed to sell stake to government: President Trump said on Friday that the U.S. government is looking to take a 10% stake in struggling chipmaker Intel. .2025-08-22: Powell indicates conditions 'may warrant' interest rate cuts as Fed proceeds 'carefully': Powell on Friday gave a tepid indication of possible cuts ahead as he noted a high level of uncertainty..2025-08-22: Canada drops many of its retaliatory tariffs on the U.S.: Canada announced Friday it was dropping many of its retaliatory tariffs on U.S. goods, though the 25% counter-tariff on autos, steel and aluminum remains..2025-08-22: John Bolton was not targeted for criticizing Trump, Vance claims after FBI raid: President Trump called former national security advisor John Bolton a \lowlife\" on the heels of court-authorized searches of his home and office by the FBI.".2025-08-22: August could end on a high note next week after Powell speech, with Nvidia earnings on tap: Investors are exiting August with greater confidence the Federal Reserve will lower interest rates next month. .2025-08-22: Cleveland Fed's Hammack casts doubt on interest rate cuts amid inflation worries: In a CNBC interview, the policymaker did not share the market's enthusiasm for a cut..2025-08-22: Here's what current and former Fed officials are saying about Lisa Cook investigation: Multiple current and former Fed officials are speaking up as Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook faces attacks from the Trump administration..2025-08-22: Higher tariffs are kicking in. Here's what Walmart and other retailers said about their impact: Consumer spending has largely stayed strong so far and the pinch from higher duties hasn't been as severe as some companies had feared. .2025-08-22: Major League Baseball closes in on new media rights deals with ESPN, NBC, Netflix : The three-year media rights deals for packages of live games come after ESPN opted out of its $550 million-per-year deal for Sunday Night Baseball..2025-08-22: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman: The AI era is 'probably the most exciting time to be starting out one's career, maybe ever': OpenAI CEO Sam Altman says AI can help young people work more efficiently than past generations, even as entry-level workers worry about jobs disappearing..2025-08-22: Inside Texas Instruments' $60 billion U.S. megaproject, where Apple will make iPhone chips: Apple committed to making iPhone chips at Texas Instruments' new U.S. factories. CNBC got an exclusive first look inside TI's $60 billion megaproject..2025-08-22: Wage growth is doing something odd in 2025 — the last time it happened was around the Great Recession: Job \switchers\" generally see wages grow at a faster pace than those who stay in their current role. However, that trend has reversed.  ".2025-08-22: Trump says he'll fire Fed Governor Lisa Cook 'if she doesn't resign': President Donald Trump said Friday he will fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook if she does not resign from her position..2025-08-22: The new gold play as investors look to hedge against risk, volatility: Gold ETFs are seeing record inflows as more investors look to get a piece of the booming gold market through portfolio diversification. .2025-08-22: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Microchip Technology, Builders FirstSource, Zoom Communications and more: Here are some of the stocks posting the biggest moves in midday trading Friday..2025-08-22: Bitcoin has hit several new all-time highs this year — and each drawdown is getting shallower: Before Friday's post-Jackson Hole rally lifted all risk assets, bitcoin traded below $112,000, its lowest level since early August..2025-08-22: The summer box office sizzled, but brace for a cooldown until November: \Superman,\" \"Lilo & Stitch\" and \"Fantastic Four\" helped propel the summer box office haul above 2024 levels, but ticket sale momentum is about to stall.".2025-08-22: Watch Fed Chair Powell's full policy speech at Jackson Hole: Markets were looking for Powell to provide strong hints about a September interest rate cut..2025-08-22: Student loan borrowers in default could soon see reduced paychecks. What to know: Student loan borrowers who've fallen behind on their payments could soon see the U.S. Department of Education take a portion of their paychecks. .2025-08-22: Cracker Barrel faces social media pushback on new logo, brand refresh: Shares of Cracker Barrel dropped roughly 7% on Thursday after the restaurant unveiled its new logo earlier this week as part of a larger brand refresh..2025-08-22: Ether surges, trading close to its record again after Powell speech teasing rate cuts: The price of ether rebounded to near-record levels on Friday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell hinted at upcoming rate cuts..2025-08-22: FBI raids home, office of John Bolton, former Trump national security advisor: FBI Director Kash Patel tweeted “NO ONE is above the law… @FBI agents on mission\ as agents searched the home of ex-Trump advisor John Bolton in Maryland.".2025-08-22: Treasury's No. 2 official Faulkender is leaving administration, Treasury says: Faulkender is the second Senate-confirmed official to leave the Treasury Department this month, following the departure of IRS Commissioner Billy Long..2025-08-22: Kimbal Musk on Elon's Tesla pay package: 'My brother deserves to be paid': The electric carmaker has been locked in a legal battle over Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package from 2018..2025-08-22: Stellantis unveils new Jeep Cherokee as brand tries to shake off sales declines: Jeep and Stellantis unveiled a new Jeep Cherokee on Thursday in a bid to reinvigorate the company's sales..2025-08-22: Powell hints at potential interest rate cuts. What that means for homeowners hoping to refinance: Fed Chair Jerome Powell hinted at potential interest rate cuts on Friday. If the slash materializes, experts say the move could be \good news\" for mortgages.".2025-08-22: Fed's Powell signals rate cuts are coming, and the stocks that need them the most are flying: Home Depot is soaring more than 4%. Caterpillar is surging too. .2025-08-22: John Deere faces a crossroads amid decreasing demand, increasing investments: John Deere has reported significant hits from weaker agricultural demand, but Wall Street still sees optimism for the company's road ahead..2025-08-22: The U.S.-EU deal is here. Europe's businesses remain on edge: The U.S. and European Union shared an updated trade framework on Thursday, granting businesses some much needed clarity.2025-08-22: Dow soars 900 points to record as Powell speech sparks market rally: Live updates: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Friday signaled the central bank could begin easing monetary policy next month..2025-08-22: The British pound’s ‘bizarre behavior’ is dividing market watchers on what comes next: Sterling has had a bumpy ride so far this year — and the currency is still struggling to shake off some pessimism. .2025-08-22: Nvidia in talks with U.S. to sell a more advanced chip to China, Jensen Huang says: Nvidia's issues in China are mounting, even after the U.S. government approved the H20 for export to the Asian country..2025-08-22: Chocolate lovers, brace yourselves: Prices are rising, but not forever: \There is this ongoing deficit in the in the market, big depletion of availability of cocoa beans and availability of products,\" one analyst told CNBC.".2025-08-22: Are Britain’s rich packing up? Here's what's behind the tax crackdown fears: Claims of a mass exodus of wealthy non-doms in response to tax rises may be overblown..2025-08-22: The AI party isn't over — these will be the winners and losers, Wedbush's Dan Ives says: The AI party isn't over yet despite fears of a bubble, according to tech bull Dan Ives..2025-08-22: DeepSeek hints latest model will be compatible with China’s ‘next generation’ homegrown AI chips: Chinese artificial intelligence startup DeepSeek has hinted that China will soon have homegrown \next generation\" chips to support its AI development. ".2025-08-22: Nvidia looking to halt H20 chip production after China cracks down on purchases, reports say  : Nvidia has reportedly told some of its component suppliers to suspend production work for its made-for-China H20 graphic processing units..2025-08-22: Nio shares pop after releasing one of its most affordable SUVs yet: Nio's U.S.-listed shares rallied, climbing 9.27% to close at $5.54. In Hong Kong, shares rose as much as 10% in Friday morning trading..2025-08-22: Major Japanese carmakers say they aren't raising prices in the U.S. because of tariffs: That comes after a Nikkei Asia report on Thursday that stated that the automakers are \passing some of the expense of U.S. tariffs.\"".2025-08-22: CNBC Daily Open: In Trump's era, Jackson Hole's no longer just for market watchers: In a typical year, Jackson Hole sparks excitement mostly among market watchers. This time, the symposium feels more pivotal..2025-08-22: Nvidia’s Huang says TSMC among all-time greats: Buying its stock is ‘very smart’ : Nvidia's Jensen Huang made a visit to Taiwan on Friday, where he showered praise on TSMC, calling it one of the greatest companies in history. .2025-08-22: India, Russia vow to deepen trade ties, defying Trump’s tariff threats over oil: India and Russia reaffirmed plans to expand trade, with New Delhi seeking to boost exports to narrow its deficit with Moscow..2025-08-22: Investing in Space: The U.S.-China space race is getting tighter: China's gaining momentum in its ambitions to further its lunar agenda, locking Beijing in an increasingly tight space competition with Washington..2025-08-22: Google scores six-year Meta cloud deal worth over $10 billion: Alphabet and Meta compete in online advertising, but Meta needs more data center infrastructure as it pursues artificial intelligence growth..2025-08-22: Elon Musk asked Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg to join xAI bid to buy OpenAI, filing shows: In early 2025, xAI CEO Elon Musk asked Meta's Mark Zuckerberg to help him finance a $97.4 billion takeover of OpenAI, new court filings revealed..2025-08-22: Asia-Pacific markets mostly rise as investors look ahead to U.S. Fed chair Powell's speech: Asia-Pacific markets were set to mostly climb Friday as investors look to Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's speech. .2025-08-22: OpenAI says HR chief Julia Villagra is leaving company: OpenAI confirmed on Thursday that Julia Villagra, the company's chief people officer, is leaving at the end of the week. .2025-08-22: California voters will decide whether to adopt a new Democratic-drawn congressional map: Democratic legislators and Gov. Gavin Newsom are selling Thursday's plans for a November statewide vote as a counterweight to Texas Republicans' redistricting..2025-08-22: Judge says Alina Habba, Trump's top federal prosecutor in New Jersey, not lawfully appointed: Alina Habba, who has served as the acting U.S. Attorney for New Jersey, is a former lawyer for President Donald Trump..2025-08-22: Fed Chair Powell set to deliver big Jackson Hole speech Friday. Here's what Wall Street expects: Powell is set to deliver what almost certainly will be his last keynote address at the central bank's annual conclave..2025-08-22: Japan reports hotter-than-expected core inflation for July — but lowest since March as rice prices ease: The figure — which strips out costs for fresh food — was higher than the 3% expected by economists polled by Reuters..2025-08-22: 8 types of personal loans and how they work: Personal loans can be a safe and affordable form of financing. CNBC Select explains how to choose the one that's right for you..2025-08-22: Ghislaine Maxwell interview released by DOJ; Epstein procurer questioned about Trump: The Trump administration has been criticized for reneging on promises to release files about sex offenders Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

Outlook.description: A sector outlook describes the expected future performance and conditions based on data, trends, and risks.
Outlook.title: Outlook

Catalyst.description: A primary catalyst of a sector is the single most influential force that is expected to drive major change—positive or negative—across an entire industry.
Catalyst.title: Catalyst

Trading_insights.description: Practical, actionable interpretation of the sector's expected future conditions—something that can guide investment or trading decisions.
Trading_insights.title: Trading Insights

Direction_momentum.description: The direction of momentum of a sector is the prevailing trend in how that sector's prices, performance, and investor sentiment are moving over a given period.
Direction_momentum.title: Direction Momentum

Sector_vs_market_position.description: Relative positioning of a sector to the overall market is the sector's performance and strength compared to the broader market, showing whether it is leading, lagging, or moving in line with the market trend.
Sector_vs_market_position.title: Sector Vs Market Position

Outlook.description: A sector outlook describes the expected future performance and conditions based on data, trends, and risks.

Catalyst.description: A primary catalyst of a sector is the single most influential force that is expected to drive major change—positive or negative—across an entire industry.

Trading_insights.description: Practical, actionable interpretation of the sector's expected future conditions—something that can guide investment or trading decisions.

Catalyst.description: A primary catalyst of a sector is the single most influential force that is expected to drive major change—positive or negative—across an entire industry.
Catalyst.title: Catalyst

Trading_insights.description: Practical, actionable interpretation of the sector's expected future conditions—something that can guide investment or trading decisions.
Trading_insights.title: Trading Insights

Direction_momentum.description: The direction of momentum of a sector is the prevailing trend in how that sector's prices, performance, and investor sentiment are moving over a given period.
Direction_momentum.title: Direction Momentum

Sector_vs_market_position.description: Relative positioning of a sector to the overall market is the sector's performance and strength compared to the broader market, showing whether it is leading, lagging, or moving in line with the market trend.
Sector_vs_market_position.title: Sector Vs Market Position

Outlook.description: A sector outlook describes the expected future performance and conditions based on data, trends, and risks.
Outlook.title: Outlook

Catalyst.description: A primary catalyst of a sector is the single most influential force that is expected to drive major change—positive or negative—across an entire industry.
Catalyst.title: Catalyst

Trading_insights.description: Practical, actionable interpretation of the sector's expected future conditions—something that can guide investment or trading decisions.
Trading_insights.title: Trading Insights

Direction_momentum.description: The direction of momentum of a sector is the prevailing trend in how that sector's prices, performance, and investor sentiment are moving over a given period.
Direction_momentum.title: Direction Momentum

Sector_vs_market_position.description: Relative positioning of a sector to the overall market is the sector's performance and strength compared to the broader market, showing whether it is leading, lagging, or moving in line with the market trend.
Sector_vs_market_position.title: Sector Vs Market Position

quarter-point cut last week was premature..2025-09-22: White House denies Homan received $50k from undercover FBI agents: The White House denied reports that border czar Tom Homan accepted $50,000 in cash last year from undercover FBI agents. .2025-09-22: Watch new Fed Governor Stephen Miran speak live on the economy and interest rates: Miran speaks Monday to the Economic Club of New York to explain his views on the economy and monetary policy..2025-09-22: Priced out of traditional housing, more Americans are living in RVs: Moving into an RV may seem like a way to save money, but it can $100,000 fee on H-1B visas: The announcement to impose a $100,000 annual fee on H-1B visas sent shockwaves through corporate America. .2025-09-22: India is betting $18 billion to build a chip Catalyst.description: A primary catalyst of a sector is the single most influential force that is expected to drive major change—positive or negative—across an entire industry.
Catalyst.title: Catalyst

Trading_insights.description: Practical, actionable interpretation of the sector's expected future conditions—something that can guide investment or trading decisions.
Trading_insights.title: Trading Insights

Direction_momentum.description: The direction of momentum of a sector is the prevailing trend in how that sector's prices, performance, and investor sentiment are moving over a given period.
Direction_momentum.title: Direction Momentum

Sector_vs_market_position.description: Relative positioning of a sector to the overall market is the sector's performance and strength compared to the broader market, showing whether it is leading, lagging, or moving in line with the market trend.
Sector_vs_market_position.title: Sector Vs Market Position

2025-10-05: At 95, Warren Buffett proves he’s still the sharpest dealmaker with $10 billion OxyChem deal: The transaction reflects Buffett's investment acumen: buying a good business at an attractive price, while skirting the possibility of costly headaches. .2025-10-05: Prologis, Amazon and Meta sign low-carbon concrete pact: Concrete manufacturing, and especially cement production, accounts for 8% of global greenhouse gas emissions, according to the World Economic Forum..2025-10-05: Judge temporarily blocks use of National Guard in Portland: The ruling is a setback for the Trump administration as it seeks to use military troops in some Democratic-run cities. The administration has appealed..2025-10-05: Wall Street flies blind into the new week with stocks still surging to record highs : The conventional wisdom goes that stocks can continue their bull rally so long as the suspension of federal operations doesn't continue for longer than usual. .2025-10-05: Global week ahead: Bull markets, bubbles and 'Swiftonomics': The U.S. government shutdown has stoked worries about its adverse impact globally, but it has not hit the risk-on sentiment across major equity markets.

Plus, Lale Akoner, eToro's global market analyst, weighs in on the catalysts that helped bitcoin hit a new all-time high..2025-10-06: U.S. says subsidies for rural airline to expire as soon as Sunday: The Trump administration said Monday that subsidies for commercial air service to rural airports are set to expire as soon as Sunday due to the shutdown..2025-10-06: U.S. air traffic controllers urged to stay on job despite government shutdown: The union representing air traffic controllers urged workers to continue working during the partial government shutdown that requires them to work without pay..2025-10-06: Anthropic lands its biggest enterprise deployment ever with Deloitte deal: Deloitte is rolling out Anthropic's Claude to more than 470,000 employees across 150 countries..2025-10-06: The 2025 box office is headed for its best post-Covid haul as winter releases heat up: The winter movie slate includes \Wicked: For Good,\" \"Zootopia 2\" and \"Avatar: Fire and Ash\" and is expected to push the 2025 box office to a post-pandemic high.".2025-10-06: Utility stocks are benefiting from the AI boom. This one could be the next to break out: Katie Stockton breaks down an interesting triangle chart pattern forming in one utility..2025-10-06: Nike's turnaround will 'take a while' amid stock slump, CEO Elliott Hill says: Nike has been executing a turnaround under CEO Elliott Hill, who told CNBC it will take \a while\" for the company to return to profitable growth.".2025-10-06: Tesla teaser video sparks speculation of long-awaited Roadster or mass market model: Tesla posted a teaser video on X sparking speculation that the company could finally be about to launch the next-generation Roadster or a mass market model..2025-10-06: Supreme Court rejects appeal of Ghislaine Maxwell for Epstein abetting conviction: Ghislaine Maxwell, the convicted procurer of Jeffrey Epstein, may now focus efforts to get a pardon or sentence commutation from President Donald Trump..2025-10-06: Fifth Third Bancorp to buy Comerica for $10.9 billion in all-stock deal: Fifth Third Bancorp said Monday it will acquire fellow regional bank Comerica in an all-stock deal worth $10.9 billion..2025-10-06: Instagram will award top creators with a gold ring. Deal Days 2025, including a discounted Prime membership and a $150 gift card: Prime Big Deal Days, Amazon's second big sale of the year, offers deep discounts to Prime Members..2025-10-06: They're already rich — Jim Cramer says 'don't get scared out' of stocks by billionaires: CNBC's Jim Cramer warned individual investors about Monday's comments made by hedge fund manager Paul Tudor contractor SciTec for $855 million to beef up its national security offering. .2025-10-06: Online holiday spending growth set to slow to 5.3% as shoppers seek discounts: Retail sales in the U.S. have chugged along, but concerns about higher tariffs and dipping consumer confidence have complicated the holiday outlook..2025-10-06: Treasury Secretary Bessent to remain as IRS commissioner after direction of CEOs..2025-10-06: S&P 500 rises to start week, AMD lifts the Nasdaq: Live updates: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composite rose on Monday as AMD shares surged on a partnership with as markets reacted to the shock resignation of France's Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu..2025-10-06: BYD's UK sales soar 880%, making it the EV-maker's largest market outside China: BYD's hybrid SEAL U DM-i and electric SEALION 7 proved popular among U.K. consumers and dominated sales, the company said. .2025-10-06: Who is Sanae Takaichi? The first woman set to helm the Japanese government: Takaichi's victory follows Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba's resignation after bruising electoral losses for the LDP in 2024 and 2025..2025-10-06: Aston Martin shares fall 10% as luxury carmaker issues fresh profit warning on tariff turmoil: Britain’s Aston Martin on Monday warned of a steeper full-year loss than market consensus, citing U.S. tariff turbulence. .2025-10-06: EU's von der Leyen confronts fresh no confidence challenges: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will face bids to remove her for the second time in three months..2025-10-06: Nobel medicine prize goes to researchers into immune system precision: American scientists Mary Brunkow and Fred Ramsdell and Shimon Sakaguchi from Japan won the 2025 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine on Monday..2025-10-06: Japan’s bond vigilantes brace for looser fiscal stance after Sanae Takaichi wins party vote: Japan's government bond market faces a test of faith under incoming Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi. .2025-10-06: U.S. tech giants hit pause on India data center deals under weight of trade uncertainty: India’s data center boom has hit a pause as U.S. Big Tech companies rethink billion-dollar projects, wary of trade, visa fees, and a geopolitical chill..2025-10-06: Japan stocks hit record highs as Sanae Takaichi's LDP victory drives yen past 150: Japan equities jumped after the country's ruling Liberal Democratic Party elected staunch conservative Sanae Takaichi as its new leader Saturday..2025-10-06: Mongolia to join data center frenzy with Chinggis Khaan sovereign wealth fund: Mongolia plans to build more data centers as the country readies its first sovereign wealth fund, tapping to the rising global demand for data center capacity. .2025-10-06: Indonesia reinstates TikTok's license after app shares data amid protest fallout: Indonesia has lifted its suspension of TikTok's local operating license after the company shared data requested by the government. .2025-10-06: CNBC Daily Open: Lights out and away we go into the new week: Important developments are afoot: Japan's on the verge of seeing its first female prime minister, OPEC+ supply increases, and weak jobs data in the U.S. .2025-10-06: The Russell 2000 just topped 2,500 for the first time ever. There's still more gains ahead: Many investors are thinking the asset class could finally break out after years of underperformance..2025-10-06: Senate to vote again on funding bill as government shutdown stalemate enters sixth day: President Donald Trump could \start taking sharp measures\" if the Senate does not pass the funding bill, White House economic advisor Kevin Hassett said.".2025-10-06: 'There will start to be layoffs' if Trump decides shutdown talks have stalled, Hassett says: Democrats are holding firm on their health-care demands, pushing to include a permanent extension of enhanced premium tax credits in funding legislation..2025-10-06: 36-year-old American Air Force vet pays $850 to rent his 2-bedroom apartment in Vietnam— take a look inside: Markeiz Ryan moved to Vietnam in 2019 and lives in a two-bedroom apartment in Ho Chi Minh City..2025-10-06: Ex-Tesla board member reveals how he's playing the EV boom: \Whoever wins this technology battle is likely to have the most valuable vehicle company in the world,\"  former Tesla board member Steve Westly said.".2025-10-06: Prosecutor resists Trump pressure to criminally charge New York AG James: MSNBC: President Trump has complained for years about New York Attorney General Letitia James, who won a lawsuit accusing him and his company of business fraud.

2025-10-07: Gold prices keep rising, and jewelry companies are sounding the alarm: Some jewelry companies who aim to offer gold pieces at lower price points are beginning to sound the alarm on higher prices for the precious metal..2025-10-07: Trump suggests not all furloughed workers will get back pay: 'It depends': Trump also said at the White House that if the shutdown drags on several days longer, a \substantial\" number of jobs \"will never come back.\"".2025-10-07: Tesla prices Model Y standard below $40,000, debuting more affordable vehicle: The unveiling could be a long-awaited lower-cost model, the next-generation Roadster, or something else..2025-10-07: Republicans face pressure to consider Democrats' health care demands as shutdown drags on: Democrats have refused to vote for any funding legislation unless it includes an extension of Obamacare subsidies, which are due to expire before January..2025-10-07: S&P 500 heads for first decline in 8 days on Oracle slide, shutdown angst: Live updates: Investors await more developments on the current U.S. government shutdown that is now on its second week..2025-10-07: This crypto-related stock is setting up for a major move higher, according to the charts: Todd Gordon breaks down the technical outlook for this crypto stock. .2025-10-07: Bitcoin retreats from record as crypto rally cools: CNBC Crypto World: On today's episode of CNBC Crypto World, bitcoin pulls back from its new record above $126,000. Plus, John Haar, managing director at Swan Bitcoin, discusses the crypto market's retreat and how macroeconomic factors could drive bitcoin's price in the fourth quarter..2025-10-07: Oracle stock slips 5% on report company is seeing thin cloud margins from Nvidia chips: Oracle had 14% gross margins on $900 million in sales in its Nvidia cloud business in the three months ending in August, according to the report..2025-10-07: Billionaire tech investor Orlando Bravo says 'valuations in AI are at a bubble': One key difference between the dotcom bubble and today, Bravo said, is that big companies with healthy balance sheets are financing tech startups..2025-10-07: OpenAI's Sora 2 must stop allowing copyright infringement, Motion Picture Association says: The Motion Picture Association called out OpenAI's new video generation model Sora 2 for content infringement..2025-10-07: How the S&P 500 performed after 10 previous government shutdowns: The S&P 500 is up since the government shutdown began. Apparently, that's not unusual. Here's what the stalemate in Washington means for investors. .2025-10-07: Consumer outlook sours as inflation expectations rise, New York Fed survey finds: Americans are increasingly pessimistic about their financial future as a wave of economic uncertainty takes hold..2025-10-07: The shutdown meant no jobs report. Carlyle's analysis shows it would have been pretty bad: The firm said its proprietary data showed job growth of just 17,000 for the month, which would be even less than the 22,000 gain in August..2025-10-07: PepsiCo shares have struggled against Coca-Cola. That may change after earnings Thursday: Jay Woods breaks down the charts on PepsiCo into results Thursday before the bell..2025-10-07: Pretax vs. Roth 401(k) contributions: This lesser-known calculation could help you decide : It's not easy to decide between pretax vs. Roth 401(k) contributions. But this lesser-known calculation could help you decide, experts say. .2025-10-07: AG Bondi stonewalls question about Trump mentions in Epstein files at Senate hearing : The Trump administration for months has faced criticism for refusing to release files about Jeffrey Epstein, a former friend of President Trump..2025-10-07: Investors are making up the highest share of homebuyers in 5 years: Real estate investors, both individual and institutional, bought one-third of all single-family residential properties sold in the second quarter of 2025..2025-10-07: Trilogy Metals shares soar over 200% after U.S. takes stake in minerals explorer: Shares of U.S.-listed Trilogy Metals surged more than 225% on Tuesday, shortly after the White House said it would take a 10% stake in the Canadian company..2025-10-07: We're buying more of this stock that Cramer calls 'the best story in this market': We have been patiently waiting for a pullback in shares..2025-10-07: Inside Rivian's design factory and the story behind those distinct headlights: CNBC goes inside Rivian’s design lab in Irvine, California, where Chief Design Officer Jeff Hammoud shares how it created its adventure-driven EV lineup..2025-10-07: September, typical boom month for shipping, looks more like freight recession this year: Freight data indicates that September, which is typically a boom month for shipping ahead of the holidays, is playing out like a freight recession this year. .2025-10-07: AMD is rallying day two after a very bullish call from Wall Street: Jefferies upgraded AMD to buy and sees a big rally in the shares ahead..2025-10-07: Johnson & Johnson ordered to pay $966 million after jury finds company liable in talc cancer case: J&J stopped selling talc-based baby powder in the U.S. in 2020, switching to a cornstarch product..2025-10-07: NYSE-owner Intercontinental Exchange rises after it takes $2 billion stake in Polymarket: Intercontinental Exchange rose more than 3% in the premarket after the company announced it took a $2 billion stake in prediction markets platform Polymarket..2025-10-07: New IRS CEO is also head of the Social Security Administration. Here's why that dual role worries some experts: The new IRS CEO, Frank Bisignano, is also Commissioner of the Social Security Administration. Here's why the dual role worries policy experts, consumer advocates..2025-10-07: The top 10 jobs employers are hiring for right now, according to a new Monster report: Health care positions led the charge in Monster's top 10 hottest jobs right now, but logistics and customer service roles also made the cut..2025-10-07: Dell stock pops as company ups long-term revenue growth expectations: Dell stock popped after the company raised its long-term revenue and profit growth forecasts..2025-10-07: Gold price reaches $4,000 an ounce for the first time ever: Gold futures have gained more than 50% this year as the dollar has weakened and President Donald Trump threatens Federal Reserve independence. .2025-10-07: Ray Dalio says today is like the early 1970s and investors should hold more gold than usual: \Gold is the only asset that somebody can hold and you don't have to depend on somebody else to pay you money for,\" Dalio said.".2025-10-07: Qualcomm acquires Italian hardware company Arduino to push deeper into robotics: Arduino's inexpensive programmable boards are ubiquitous inside hardware startups and robotics labs for prototyping. .2025-10-07: WTO hikes global trade forecast for 2025 — but next year doesn't look so good: Global trade volumes rose sharply in the first half of 2025 as businesses front-loaded imports ahead of higher tariffs..2025-10-07: Avoid banks and telcos: Strategists share how to trade ‘ungovernable’ France: Political turmoil is fuelling \desynchronized growth\" in Europe, with French domestic-facing stocks expected to lose out.".2025-10-07: France is plunged further into political crisis. Here’s what could happen next: Macron now has to choose a new PM, opt for new parliamentary elections or resign. .2025-10-07: Déjà vu in France as political chaos returns. But this time, it's different: On the one hand, there is an air of déjà vu in France now: the next PM will be Macron's sixth in less than two years. But this time it's different..2025-10-07: World Bank raises China growth forecast to 4.8% despite U.S. trade tensions: The World Bank now projects 4.8% growth for China, up from 4.0% predicted earlier this year. .2025-10-07: Israeli forces shell Gaza on war anniversary, Hamas and Israel discuss Trump plan : Israeli tanks, boats and jets pounded parts of Gaza on Tuesday, giving Palestinians no respite on the anniversary of the Hamas attack..2025-10-07: Nobel physics prize goes to pioneers of quantum mechanics: U.S.-based scientists John Clarke, Michel Devoret and John Martinis won the 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics..2025-10-07: Japan's Nikkei 225 hits record high for second straight day after Wall Street gains on AMD rally: Overnight, shares of AMD skyrocketed almost 24% after it announced a deal with OpenAI, which could see the latter take a 10% stake in the chipmaker..2025-10-07: Japan's Takaichi picks ex-premier Aso as party vice president: Former premier and party heavyweight Taro Aso was finance minister when former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe deployed his \Abenomics\" stimulus policies in 2013.".2025-10-07: CNBC Daily Open: The AI industry's 'happy few' : The arrangement between OpenAI and AMD adds a new layer to the increasingly circular nature of AI's corporate economy..2025-10-07: Staffing issues cause delays at U.S. airports as shutdown persists: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said that at times, air traffic staffing has been cut by 50% in some areas since the shutdown started last week..2025-10-07: How Ares is capitalizing on the 'retail revolution' in alternative assets: Ares Management already has more than $50 billion in assets under management from semiliquid vehicles targeted at retail. .2025-10-07: This animal health stock is up 70% in 2025. JPMorgan says it has further gains: Analyst Chris Schott upgraded the stock to overweight from neutral..2025-10-07: 7-Eleven bets a Japanese makeover can fix its U.S. stores: 7-Eleven is revamping its U.S. stores with a Japanese fix, as it tries to spark more food sales at the convenience stores..2025-10-07: European stocks edge lower at close; Gucci-owner Kering up 5.8% as French stocks rebound: European stocks closed provisionally lower on Tuesday, but French stocks rebounded following  the resignation of Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu..2025-10-07: Billionaire tech investor Orlando Bravo says 'valuations in AI are at a bubble': One key difference between the dot-com bubble and today, Bravo said, is that big companies with healthy balance sheets are financing tech startups.

Plus, Rep. Bryan Steil (R-Wisc.) discusses whether the ongoing government shutdown could delay the passage of crypto market structure regulation..2025-10-08: 5 things Nvidia's Jensen Huang said about the state of the AI race with China: While the U.S. may be leading in advanced chip designs, Huang warned not to discount China's growing chip development..2025-10-08: 31-year-old kept renting years after she made millions—why she decided to buy a home now: Tori Dunlap credits renting with helping her build her business and net worth. Outlook.description: A sector outlook describes the expected future performance and conditions based on data, trends, and risks.
Outlook.title: Outlook

Catalyst.description: A primary catalyst of a sector is the single most influential force that is expected to drive major change—positive or negative—across an entire industry.
Catalyst.title: Catalyst

Trading_insights.description: Practical, actionable interpretation of the sector's expected future conditions—something that can guide investment or trading decisions.
Trading_insights.title: Trading Insights

Direction_momentum.description: The direction of momentum of a sector is the prevailing trend in how that sector's prices, performance, and investor sentiment are moving over a given period.
Direction_momentum.title: Direction Momentum

Sector_vs_market_position.description: Relative positioning of a sector to the overall market is the sector's performance and strength compared to the broader market, showing whether it is leading, lagging, or moving in line with the market trend.
